No. Randuin's Omen gives better armor and less health. Righteous Glory gives a TEAM ACTIVE that is completely unrelated to this.

Here's the thing: Righteous Glory got nerfed because it was a supportish item being built on bruisers and fighters and non-tank supports. Okay. So the idea of the fighter or the bruiser, who has lots of damage, giving his team utility is bad. But having an item in the game that not only has a pretty decent armor and health bonus, but also gives you damage once you finally catch that stupid Kalista AND passively increases your move speed over time without a cooldown or an active to manage?

It's great. It reduces the micro required for split second decision engages and rewards you for getting there. It's a selfish Glory, or as it was once known, Force of Nature. 

With Meddler stating that armor items are getting nerfed, we definitely need a good armor/health item. If Sunfire Cape's armor drops to 40 and Randuin's drops to 50, then Dead Man's Plate could stay at 55 and be the selfish, non-team related single target damage item with some mobility. That's fair, and that's how bruiser items should be designed. Tanky and initiation, with some conditional damage that doesn't affect their actual ratios.

**Items that could definitely work healthily in game:**
{{item:3742}} Definitely a plus to any tank's repertoire. For when Ninja Tabi just doesn't cut it.
{{item:3433}} and all its descendants. Splitpushing, kiting and aoe damage enablers that aren't too overpowered.

{{item:3844}} Potential new support start? Yes please. Helps against super pokey lanes when you don't need the tankiness of Relic Shield.
{{item:3745}} Really cool support option to counter super mobile opposition. Actually pretty good on Bard.
{{item:3744}} Cool option for roaming mages.
**Items that might work:**
{{item:3829}} Fun, but not OP. Kinda like Zz'Rot's, it's a cool strategic option that works in some cases but isn't overpowering.
{{item:3911}} Potentially broken? I don't really know.

{{item:3924}} Yes, please, help the Farm2Win champions even more.
